intro: Solanum moricandii var. majus, commonly known as the giant hairy nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial native to Central Asia. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, hairy leaves and showy, violet-pink flowers. The plant produces berries that turn from green to red as they mature, and the fruits are edible when fully ripe. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens in regions with suitable climates.
